content.question: Which of the following diagrams correctly illustrates the nitrogen cycle?

choices.label: Each option presents a diagram of a tree in the ground. The space above the tree is labeled Air and the space below the tree is labeled Soil. A: In the air, to the left of the tree is N 2, with an arrow pointing down and to the right to N H 4 with a positive one charge, in the soil. Two arrows extend up and to the right from N H 4 with a positive one charge, one to the tree, and one to N O 2 with a negative one charge, located in the soil. There is an arrow pointing up and to the right from N O 2 with a negative one charge to N O 3 with a negative one charge, located in the soil. There are two arrows extending from N O 3 with a negative one charge, one to the tree and one out of the soil, to N 2 in the air to the right of the tree.

In the air, to the left of the tree is N H 4 with a positive one charge, with an arrow pointing down to N 2, in the soil. There is an arrow pointing down and to the right from N 2 to N H 4 with a positive one charge. There is an arrow pointing down and to the right from N H 4 with a positive one charge to N O 3 with a negative one charge. There is a line that slopes up and to the right from N O 3 with a negative one charge to N H 3, located in the soil. There is an arrow from N H 3 to N 2, located in the air to the right of the tree.

In the air, to the left of the tree is N H 4 with a positive one charge, with an arrow pointing down to H 2 N O 3, located in the soil. There is an arrow pointing down and to the right from H 2 N O 3 to N H 3. There is a line that slopes up and to the right from N H 3 to N O 3 with a negative one charge, located in the soil. There is an arrow pointing from N O 3 with a negative one charge to the tree. There is also an arrow pointing down and to the right from N H 3 to N 2. There is a line that slopes up and to the right from N 2 to N O 2 with a negative one charge, located in the soil. There is an arrow pointing up and to the right from N O 2 with a negative one charge to N 2, located in the air to the right of the tree.

In the air, to the left of the tree is N O 3 with a negative one charge, with an arrow pointing down to N O 2 with a negative one charge, located in the soil. There is an arrow pointing down and to the right from N O 2 with a negative one charge to N 2. There is an arrow pointing down and to the right from N 2 to N H 4. There is an arrow pointing from the tree down to N H 4. There is a line that slopes up and to the right from N H 4 to N H 3, located in the soil. There is an arrow from N H 3 to N O 3 with a negative one charge, located in the air to the right of the tree.

There is an arrow pointing from the tree to N O 2 with a negative one charge in the air, to the left of the tree. There is an arrow pointing down from N O 2 with a negative one charge to N O 3 with a negative one charge, located in the soil. There is an arrow pointing down and to the right from N O 3 with a negative one charge to N 2. There is an arrow pointing down and to the right from N 2 to N H 3. There is a line that slopes up and to the left from N H 3 to N H 4 with a positive one charge, located in the soil underneath the tree. There is an arrow from N H 4 with a positive one charge pointing to the bottom of the tree, located in the soil.

content.answer: Each option presents a diagram of a tree in the ground. The space above the tree is labeled Air and the space below the tree is labeled Soil. A: In the air, to the left of the tree is N 2, with an arrow pointing down and to the right to N H 4 with a positive one charge, in the soil. Two arrows extend up and to the right from N H 4 with a positive one charge, one to the tree, and one to N O 2 with a negative one charge, located in the soil. There is an arrow pointing up and to the right from N O 2 with a negative one charge to N O 3 with a negative one charge, located in the soil. There are two arrows extending from N O 3 with a negative one charge, one to the tree and one out of the soil, to N 2 in the air to the right of the tree.

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Describe characteristics of an environmental concept, process, or model represented visually.
